citeinfo.title: Oceanographic Data Collected in the Sea of Japan

descript.abstract: The archive of oceanographic data (water temperature, salinity, nutrients, oxygen content) obtained in the surveys conducted by TINRO within the limits of the Sea of Japan (mainly in Russian EEZ, mainly in 0 - 200 M layer) with inclusion the data of standard section along 132Â°E. (Notes: Since 2000, the metadata are available through NEAR-GOOS Delayed Mode Data Base (Russia).)
descript.purpose: The observations were carried out for two purposes: 1) oceanographical monitoring for understanding the regularities of variability of observed properties for their prediction; 2) for the purposes of biological oceanography (coupling with biological data: plankton and fish/squid distribution).

sngdate.caldate: 1926, major part of the archive since 1984, ending in recent times.

idinfo.accconst: Official exchange or relations of collaboration.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
